briefTitle: Drotaverine Hydrochloride Versus Hyoscine-N-butylbromide for Duodenal Antimotility During Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP)
officialTitle: Drotaverine Hydrochloride Versus Hyoscine-N-butylbromide for Duodenal Antimotility During ERCP: a Prospective, Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial
summary: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the use of drotaverine hydrochloride versus hyoscine-N-butylbromide in reducing duodenal motility during diagnostic and therapeutic ERCP.

primaryOutcome.measure: The Grades of the Number of Duodenal Contractions
